intro: Hibbertia cymosa, commonly known as the clustered flame bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers that bloom in late winter to spring. The plant has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hibbertia cymosa is typically found in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its striking floral display makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
